item.title: Blockchain Technology Now Enters Educational Institutions - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Blockchain Technology Now Enters Educational Institutions - NEWSBTC

Educational institutions are working on implementing bitcoin technology to maintain academic records. Read more... Blockchain technology, initially developed to record and confirm all digital currency transactions happening over the bitcoin network is increasingly being used in various industries.

item.title: Is bitcoin mining even worth it anymore?
item.description:
Is bitcoin mining even worth it anymore?

Answer (1 of 2): Its depends on the scale of the operation. Because it's an economy of scale, there would be points as you get larger where you start off losing money, then break even, and assuming the btc price doesn't rocket up(increasing hash power as a side effect) you will eventually turn a ...

item.title: What is Hillary Clinton's policy on bitcoins and cryptocurrencies?
item.description:
What is Hillary Clinton's policy on bitcoins and cryptocurrencies?

I'm a Clinton supporter. I like Bernie. If he's nominated, I'll donate and work hard for him. I prefer Clinton's wide experience and deep competency. And fundamentally, I think her visions of what needs to be addressed and how are more in line with my views.

item.title: What is the mathematics behind a blockchain problem?
item.description:
What is the mathematics behind a blockchain problem?

Answer: There are lots of problems. It depends on which you refer to. The one the allowed the whole system to work, the problem that couldn't be cracked for more than a decade or two is the bayzentine generals problem, though there are many other problems that had to be solved and combined to ...

item.title: How is it possible to lose Bitcoins if they are traceable?
item.description:
How is it possible to lose Bitcoins if they are traceable?

Answer (1 of 2): Bitcoins are lost, because the private keys of a bitcoin address is stolen. A bitcoin address is the public key of a public key-private key, key-pair. All wallets have a function to import/export private keys, to enhance security. So, if the corresponding private keys, of a bitco...

item.title: What would you call the blockchain if you were to rename it?
item.description:
What would you call the blockchain if you were to rename it?

Answer (1 of 3): Cryptographically Authenitic Shared Distributed Ledger

item.title: Keiser Report: Bitcoin Core versus Bitcoin Classic (E912)
item.description:
Keiser Report: Bitcoin Core versus Bitcoin Classic (E912)

Every week Max Keiser looks at all the scandal behind the financial news headlines. In this episode of the Keiser Report, Max and Stacy discuss Goldman Sachs managing to deplete the teamsters' pension fund more successfully and rapidly than the mob could ever manage to.

item.title: The Winklevoss Twins Add Ether to Bitcoin Exchange
item.description:
The Winklevoss Twins Add Ether to Bitcoin Exchange

May 12 -- Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, Gemini Trust Company co-founders, discuss their bitcoin exchange and the future of cryptocurrencies. They speak with Bloomberg's Erik Schatzker at the SALT Conference in Las Vegas on "Bloomberg West."
